documentation.author: CERNER INNOVATION
documentation.purpose: This rule provides a rolling 24-hour total for acetaminophen administrations to ensure that the maximum daily dose of acetaminophen is not exceeded based upon administration records.
documentation.explanation:
This rule is triggered upon selection of the administration task on the eMAR. It displays the rolling 24 hour acetaminophen dosage that has been administered and includes the dosage being administered from the selected task and also alerts the user if the calculated dosage will exceed the 24 hour maximum (75mg/kg/day or 4000 mg/day).
The alert message can be suppressed to only display to the user when a defined 24 hour total threshold has been exceeded. In addition, the rule will notify users if the selected acetaminophen task is related to a non-referenced medication (one which does not have an associated MMDC). If the medication selected is a non-referenced medication, the 24 hour rolling total cannot be calculated.
NOTE: For the 24 hour rolling total of acetaminophen administered to be accurate for combination products, the combination product must be built with a volume dose and volume dose unit (ie 1 tab(s)) in the order details.
documentation.impact:
***IMPORTANT INFORMATION - PLEASE READ***
For further set up instructions including test scripts, please refer to the Supplemental Documentation included within the Content Package.
EVOKE SECTION:
MEDCHARTACTIVATE This evoke allows the rule to fire from the MAR when the user selects any medication containing acetaminophen.
E1 - This template contains all the acetaminophen and acetaminophen containing combinations to be considered by the rule
LOGIC SECTION: ALL EKS_BUILD_MESSAGE templates: No modification needed UNLESS the numbers of the substitution values need to be changed due to addition or deletion of other templates. These templates are used to collect data. Do NOT modify the names in the MSGNAME parameters.
L3 - This template contains all the acetaminophen and acetaminophen containing combinations to be considered by the rule (should be the same list as E1)
L8 Contains the maximum daily dose of acetaminophen. This number can be modified by the client. This is used by the script in L22.
L10 Valid DNUM for medications containing acetaminophen. This can be modified by the client. The first number needs to be the number of DNUMs used, followed by the ~. Default is 70~, but if you are only using 4 DNUMs, it would need to be 4~. These are checked by the script in L22.
L16 Contains the maximum daily dose calculation number used in mg/kg/day formula. For example, specifying 75 would cause the maximum dose calculation to be 75 mg/kg/day. This is used by the script in L22.
L18 This value will set a Total, where it will suppress alerts that do not exceed the total. For example, specifiying 2000 would suppress alerts for total doses up to and including 2000mg. This is used by the script in L22.
L20 This parameter will allow the Total dose specified in L18 to be equal to the Max dose specified in L8, and control alert suppression. For example, specifiying a 1 would suppress alerts when total dose is less than or equal to maximum dose but show alerts once that total has been exceeeded. Specifying 0 would always show alerts. This is used by the script in L22.
L22 Executes the script rules_dose_ver_get_acet. The input parameter to this script is 24 (hours). This template will be true if the total dose calculation was performed completely. This script executed in this template adds the messages @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED_ADMIN_FOUND] @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED_ORDER_FOUND] @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED]
@MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED_ADMIN_FOUND] is set to 1 if a non-reference medication was administered, causing the calculation to not be completed.
@MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED_ORDER_FOUND] is set to 1 if a non-reference medication was ordered, causing the calculation to not be completed.
@MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED] contains the order name of the non-referenced medication order.
ACTION: G1 This template will display an alert message for the user when the user clicks on Acetaminophen and total dose can be calculated accurately. This message can be modified by the client. The @MISC:22 and @MESSAGE:[MAXDAILYDOSE] in this message should not be removed or modifed.
G2 This template will display an alert message for the user when the user clicks on Acetaminophen and total dose cannot be calculated accurately due to a non-reference medication order having been administered already. This message can be modified by the client. This section will be evaluated when @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED_ADMIN_FOUND] = 1. The @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED] in this message should not be removed or modifed.
G3 This template will display an alert message for the user when the user clicks on Acetaminophen and total dose cannot be calculated accurately due to a current order for a non-reference medication. This section will be evaluated when @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED_ORDER_FOUND] = 1.This message can be modified by the client. The @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED] in this message should not be removed or modifed.

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ORDER_E
templateDefinitions.definition: the triggering request contains an order ORD_METHOD OPT_ORDERS whose ordering physician OPT_QUALIFIER in OPT_ORDDOC

statements.statement: select if (par1 ="OTHER") from prsnl pl where pl.name_full_formatted != " " and pl.name_full_formatted not between "0*" and "Z*" and pl.active_ind = 1 and pl.physician_ind = 1 elseif (par1="ALL") from prsnl pl where pl.name_full_formatted != " " and pl.active_ind=1 and pl.physician_ind = 1 else from prsnl pl where pl.physician_ind = 1 and pl.active_ind=1 and cnvtupper(pl.name_full_formatted)=patstring(concat(substring(1,1,par1),"*")) endif pl.name_full_formatted, _hidden=pl.person_id order name_full_formatted

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_STOP_LOGIC_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the following templates are false, MODE logic evaluation
templateDefinitions.description: Used to control efficiency of Action Group rules

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ORDER_INCOMING_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the triggering request contains an order ORD_METHOD OPT_ORDERS whose ordering physician OPT_QUALIFIER in OPT_ORDDOC and OPT_ORDER_DETAIL OPT_DETAIL_QUALIFIER OPT_LIST

statements.statement: select if (par1 ="OTHER") from prsnl pl where pl.name_full_formatted != " " and pl.name_full_formatted not between "0*" and "Z*" and pl.active_ind = 1 and pl.physician_ind = 1 elseif (par1="ALL") from prsnl pl where pl.name_full_formatted != " " and pl.active_ind=1 and pl.physician_ind = 1 else from prsnl pl where pl.physician_ind = 1 and pl.active_ind=1 and cnvtupper(pl.name_full_formatted)=patstring(concat(substring(1,1,par1),"*")) endif pl.name_full_formatted, _hidden=pl.person_id order name_full_formatted

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CALC_SAVE_L
templateDefinitions.description: Create a value to be used by subsequent templates

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_BUILD_MESSAGE_L
templateDefinitions.definition: ACTION a message named MSGNAME with text of MSGTEXT preceded by OPT_DELIMITER
templateDefinitions.description: Create or add to a text message to be used by subsequent templates

statements.statement:
select action = if (d.seq = 1) "Create" elseif (d.seq = 2) "Append To" ENDIF, _hidden = if (d.seq = 1) "1" elseif (d.seq = 2) "2" ENDIF
FROM (DUMMYT D WITH SEQ = VALUE(2))

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_RESULT_MOST_RECENT_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the most recent result for EVENT_SET_NAME is EVALUATION VALUE1 and OPT_VALUE2 for the same encounter as OPT_LINK over the last OPT_TIME_NUM OPT_TIME_UNIT

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_EXEC_CCL_L
templateDefinitions.definition: Execute PROGRAM_NAME with parameters OPT_PARAM and link to OPT_LINK

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ALERT_FLEX_A
templateDefinitions.definition: Send alert OPT_TITLE stating TXT, OPT_CANCEL_LABEL, OPT_IGNORE_LABEL, OPT_OVERRIDE_REASON, OPT_MODIFY_LABEL, OPT_DEFAULT_LABEL, OPT_ORDERS, OPT_DEFAULT_FIRST_ORDER, OPT_URL_BUTTON_NAME, OPT_URL_ADDRESS, OK_BUTTON_NAME, OPT_FORM, OPT_FORM_BUTTON_NAME, OPT_FORCE_FORM, OPT_LINK

statements.statement: select distinct Form_Definition = if (t.seq = 1) dfr.definition else "*NONE" endif, _hidden = if (t.seq = 1) dfr.dcp_forms_ref_id else 0.0 endif, Description = if (t.seq = 1) dfr.description else "NONE" endif from dcp_forms_ref dfr, (dummyt t with seq=2) plan dfr where dfr.active_ind = 1 and textlen(trim(dfr.definition)) > 0 and textlen(trim(dfr.definition)) > 0 join t order Form_Definition

column.value: PowerPorm must be opened, dismiss Alert
PowerForm must be signed, dismiss Alert

value.value: select units_cdf = uar_get_code_meaning(ce.result_units_cd) from clinical_event ce where ce.clinical_event_id = @CLINICALEVENTID:12 detail if (ce.result_units_cd > 0.0) ekssub->mod = trim(units_cdf) else ekssub->mod = "" endif go
The 24hr Acetaminophen dose will be @MISC:22 the maximum daily dose of @MESSAGE:[MAXDAILYDOSE].
The order @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED] is a non-referenced medication and has been administered in the last 24 hours; therefore, the 24 Hour Acetaminophen Dose cannot be calculated.
The order @MESSAGE:[NON_REFERENCE_MED] is a non-referenced medication; therefore, the 24 Hour Acetaminophen Dose cannot be calculated.
